required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Prediction Model of 28-day Mortality in Septic Shock
clinical_study.official_title: A Prediction Model of 28-day Mortality in Septic Shock

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical study adopts the design of cohort research, selects the sepsis shock patients admitted to our hospital ICU as the research object, takes the 28-day mortality rate as the outcome index, collects the baseline data of the patient, the severity of the disease, vital signs, the main infection site, the laboratory-related index, the treatment method and other data, screens out the risk factors affecting the sepsis shock 28-day mortality rate and constructs the prediction model accordingly, analyzes the prediction model with the subject's working characteristic curve (ROC). The recognition ability of the model is calculated by the area under the ROC curve (AUC) and the ability of the model to predict 28-day mortality with SOFA and APACHE II.

primary_outcome.description: The all-cause mortality rate is measured from the time the ICU is admitted to the hospital and 28 days after admission (regardless of ICU, hospitalization or out-of-hospital mortality).

study_pop.textblock: Sepsis shock patients admitted to our hospital

overall_official.affiliation: 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University, China

facility.name: 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University, China
